Milan spy Brugge talent Danjuma
Milan have reportedly set their sights on Club Brugge striker Arnaut Danjuma Groeneveld, on loan with €10m option to buy.

The Dutch international turns 22 at the end of the month and already has one goal in two senior caps for his country.

According to De Telegraaf newspaper, he could be allowed to leave on loan with option to buy for a total of around €10m.

Danjuma is currently nursing an ankle injury and has not played since mid-October.

He only joined Club Brugge over the summer for €1m from NEC Nijmegen and started out in the PSV youth academy.

Although he plays primarily on the left flank of attack, he can also do a job on the right or as a support striker.
